entry.title: Armenia starts renovating bypass road from key Tavush village amid border delimitation

media:group.media:title: Armenia starts renovating bypass road from key Tavush village amid border delimitation
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs government started renovating a new bypass route to connect the flashpoint border village of Kirants in the country‚Äôs northwest with the rest of the country. A key bridge connecting Kirants to the rest of Armenia is set to pass to Azerbaijan‚Äôs control. üìç Armenia‚Äôs top diplomat reiterated his country‚Äôs commitment to international nuclear safety standards and met with the head of the United Nations‚Äô atomic agency. üìç Armenia‚Äôs prime minister held talks with the deputy director of the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency, while Armenia‚Äôs security chief met with Qatar‚Äôs national security advisor. Detailed readouts of those discussions were not made available. üìç Interview with Armen Grigoryan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5vd1XsnzLl0 üìç Interview with Noubar Afeyan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aYdwCNqcb04

entry.title: Politics is the business of the people #shorts

media:group.media:title: Politics is the business of the people #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Noubar Afeyan sits down with CivilNet host Eric Hacopian to review his humanitarian and charitable work in Armenia, particularly his new Spiritual Revival Foundation. They discuss the ongoing detention of philanthropist Ruben Vardanyan in Azerbaijan, what the diaspora misunderstands about Armenia, and why the quest for justice must be an integral part of Armenia‚Äôs peace process with Azerbaijan.
Afeyan is the founder and CEO of Flagship Pioneering, a company that creates bioplatform companies to transform human health and sustainability. An entrepreneur and biochemical engineer, he holds more than 100 patents and has co-founded more than 70 life science and technology startups during his 36-year career. He is the co-founder of the Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity, as well as the co-founder and chairman of the board of Moderna, the pioneering messenger RNA company that created one of the first COVID-19 vaccines. #civilnet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

media:group.media:title: Life in sign language
media:group.media:description:
In Armenia, individuals with hearing impairments face nuanced obstacles, ranging from societal acceptance to education and employment. Many don‚Äôt attend school at all, and others are educated in public schools without special resources. Amid all this, an educational center for hearing-impaired children has been operating in Yerevan since 1959 and currently offers bilingual education to 112 students. Here, they learn the Armenian language, sign language, and communication skills. However, challenges for these children often arise post-graduation, whether in pursuing higher education, seeking employment, or simply navigating daily life.

entry.title: Ukraine and Armenia: The View From Poland

media:group.media:title: Ukraine and Armenia: The View From Poland
media:group.media:description:
In an exclusive interview, Civilnet speaks with Piotr Skwiecinski, Ambassador of Poland to Armenia, about Poland's growing economic and strategic engagement in Armenia. The ambassador discusses key issues including the importance of supporting Armenia's sovereignty and his country's view of Georgia and Armenia's path towards Europe.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs top leaders send condolences on death of Iranian president

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs top leaders send condolences on death of Iranian president
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs prime minister sent condolences to Iran‚Äôs supreme leader following the deaths yesterday of Iranian president and top diplomat in a helicopter crash. üìç Roads to the flashpoint village of Kirants in Armenia‚Äôs northeastern Tavush region have been blocked off to outsiders, but protest leader Bagrat Galstanyan was granted access inside. üìç WATCH MORE: Interview with head of Armenia‚Äôs Security Council Armen Grigoryan: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5vd1XsnzLl0 üìç WATCH MORE: Business Weekly- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZGRrpcDmpaM

entry.title: Noubar Afeyan talks philanthropy, peacebuilding, and humanitarianism

media:group.media:title: Noubar Afeyan talks philanthropy, peacebuilding, and humanitarianism
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Noubar Afeyan sits down with CivilNet host Eric Hacopian to review his humanitarian and charitable work in Armenia, particularly his new Spiritual Revival Foundation. They discuss the ongoing detention of philanthropist Ruben Vardanyan in Azerbaijan, what the diaspora misunderstands about Armenia, and why the quest for justice must be an integral part of Armenia‚Äôs peace process with Azerbaijan.
Afeyan is the founder and CEO of Flagship Pioneering, a company that creates bioplatform companies to transform human health and sustainability. An entrepreneur and biochemical engineer, he holds more than 100 patents and has co-founded more than 70 life science and technology startups during his 36-year career. He is the co-founder of the Aurora Prize for Awakening Humanity, as well as the co-founder and chairman of the board of Moderna, the pioneering messenger RNA company that created one of the first COVID-19 vaccines.
0:00 Armenia‚Äôs new Spiritual Revival Foundation 3:22 Overcoming cultural barriers to address trauma 8:50 Working to free Ruben Vardanyan from detention 14:37 What role should the Armenian church play? 19:56 Does the diaspora misunderstand Armenia? 25:37 Artsakh‚Äôs ethnic cleansing and seeking justice
